intro: Diplycosia luzonica, commonly known as the Luzon mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Viscaraceae family and typically grows on the branches of host trees, such as those in the Dipterocarpaceae family. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white waxy coating. It produces small, inconspicuous white or pale green flowers, followed by small, fleshy berries that are dispersed by birds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
